channel.title: Check if a file is opened
channel.description: is there a way to check with java if a file or application is opened/running?

item.title: Check if a file is opened
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

He’s asking for something that is a pretty simple answer for most of you, he didn’t ask for your opinion.
Keep it on topic, please.

Read full topic

[/quote]It wouldn’t be necessary if people like you didn’t cheat.[/quote]

Just handle it from the server and forgot all this tasklist searching lol.

Random events, questions?

item.title: Check if a file is opened
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:541482”][quote author=Strucker link=topic=660352.msg4415410#msg4415410 date=1395667980]
is there a way to check with java if a file or application is opened/running?
[/quote]
Oh lord, please tell me that you’re not seriously trying to detect if an auto clicker is open…[/quote]

This ^

Idea is dumb and kinda worthless if this is your aim. Process names can be spoofed very easily and this will bypass your “check”

@fpsnipmob wrote:

If you are trying to move the file folder and its giving that error, and you’ve looked and cant find it open. Just restart your computer and try again.

item.source: Check if a file is opened

item.title: Check if a file is opened
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

public static boolean isOpen(File file) { return !file.canWrite(); }

I’m just guessing but if the application is open then it’ll return true otherwise false. It’ll return false if its not open because the canWrite() will only work if the file is not in use. I think.

Read full topic
item.source: Check if a file is opened

item.title: Check if a file is opened
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Application probably, check the process list. As for a file, try accessing it and see if you can.

ps I think I know what you’re doing. Don’t.
